arr.text: Write code as if accompanied by a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
arr.author: Steve McConnell

arr.text: The complexity of the program grows until it exceeds the programmer's ability.
arr.author: Arthur Bloch. Murphy's Laws

arr.text: Walking on water and developing programs following TK is very easy...if they are frozen.
arr.author: I. Berard

arr.text: What the mind of man can comprehend and believe he is capable of achieving.
arr.author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

arr.text: Strive not for success, but for the values it provides.
arr.author: Albert Einstein

arr.text: I owe my success to the fact that I have never made excuses or accepted excuses from others.
arr.author: Florence Nightingale

arr.text: In my career, I've missed more than 9,000 throws, lost almost 300 games.
arr.author: Michael Jordan

arr.text: The hardest thing is to get started, the rest just depends on persistence.
arr.author: Amelia Earhart

arr.text: One must love life more than the meaning of life.
arr.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

arr.text: Life is what happens to you while you're making plans.
arr.author: John Lennon

arr.text: Logic can take you from point A to point B, and imagination can take you anywhere.
arr.author: Albert Einstein

arr.text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than the things you did.
arr.author: Mark Twain

arr.text: You should always start with the things that sow doubt.
arr.author: Boris Strugatsky

arr.text: True responsibility is only personal.
arr.author: Fazil Iskander

arr.text: A meaningless life is not worth living.
arr.author: Socrates

arr.text: 80% of success is showing up in the right place at the right time.
arr.author: Woody Allen

arr.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
arr.author: Steve Jobs

arr.text: Winning isn't everything, everything is a constant desire to win.
arr.author: Vince Lombardi, American soccer coach

arr.text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life.
arr.author: Immanuel Kant

arr.text: There is no word for 'impossible' in my dictionary.
arr.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

arr.text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
arr.author: Christopher Columbus

arr.text: Freedom is worthless if it does not include the freedom to be wrong.
arr.author: Mahatma Gandhi

arr.text: Either you control your day or the day controls you.
arr.author: Jim Rohn, speaker and business coach

arr.text: If you think you can do something, you're right; if you think you can't do anything, you're right, too.
arr.author: Henry Ford

arr.text: The two most important days of your life: the day you were born, and the day you figured out why.
arr.author: Mark Twain

arr.text: Start doing everything you can do - and even things you can even dream about.
arr.author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

arr.text: The best revenge is a great success.
arr.author: Frank Sinatra

arr.text: It is often said that motivation is not long enough.
arr.author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman and marketing consultant

arr.text: Weak people spend their whole lives trying to be as good as anyone else.
arr.author: Boris Akunin

arr.text: It's all about thinking.
arr.author: Leo Tolstoy

arr.text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
arr.author: Aristotle

arr.text: The person you are destined to become is only the person you choose to become.
arr.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet and philosopher

arr.text: Walk confidently toward your dreams.
arr.author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, naturalist

arr.text: I hope that at the end of my days, when I stand before God, I won't have an ounce of talent left so that I can say to him, 'I have used everything you have given me
arr.author: Erma Bombeck, writer, journalist

arr.text: It's better to be sure of a good result than to hope for a great one.
arr.author: Warren Buffett

arr.text: Some things can capture your attention, but focus better on those things that capture your heart.
arr.author: Indian proverb

arr.text: Once you believe you can, you're halfway there.
arr.author: Theodore Roosevelt

arr.text: You shouldn't blame a child for being afraid of the dark.
arr.author: Plato

arr.text: Learn to say 'I don't know,' and that will already be progress.
arr.author: Moses Maimonides, Jewish philosopher and theologian

arr.text: Start from where you are now.
arr.author: Arthur Ashe, tennis player

arr.text: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that the most important thing in life was happiness.
arr.author: John Lennon

arr.text: Fall seven times and rise eight times.
arr.author: Japanese proverb

arr.text: When one door to happiness closes, another opens immediately.
arr.author: Helen Keller, writer, lecturer, political activist

arr.text: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone can see it.
arr.author: Confucius

arr.text: How beautiful it is that you don't have to wait a minute to start making the world a better place.
arr.author: Anne Frank

arr.text: When I am freed from who I am, I become what I can be.
arr.author: Lao Tzu

arr.text: Happiness is not something ready-made.
arr.author: Dalai Lama

arr.text: If you are offered a seat in a rocket ship, don't ask what the seat is! Just take it.
arr.author: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook COO

arr.text: Define your ideal first: set a goal.
arr.author: Aristotle

arr.text: If there is no wind, take up the oars.
arr.author: Latin proverb

arr.text: Always lean on the idea that your own decision to succeed is far more important than anything else.
arr.author: Abraham Lincoln

arr.text: Success is the ability to go from defeat to defeat without losing optimism.
arr.author: Winston Churchill

arr.text: Everyone wants to change humanity, but no one thinks about how to change themselves.
arr.author: Leo Tolstoy

arr.text: It is important to believe that talent is given to us for a reason - and that at all costs it must be used for something.
arr.author: Marie Curie

arr.text: If your inner voice tells you that you can't draw - draw as much as you can, then that voice will quiet down.
arr.author: Vincent Van Gogh

arr.text: Determination of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
arr.author: William Clement Stone, writer and businessman

arr.text: We become what we think about.
arr.author: Earl Nightingale, radio host

arr.text: I am not a victim of circumstance, I am the result of my decisions.
arr.author: Stephen Covey, organizational management consultant and trainer

arr.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago.
arr.author: Chinese proverb

arr.text: All children are artists.
arr.author: Pablo Picasso

arr.text: I was amazed at the importance of taking action.
arr.author: Leonardo da Vinci

arr.text: What is money? A man is successful if he wakes up in the morning, goes back to bed in the evening, and does what he likes at recess.
arr.author: Bob Dylan

arr.text: I didn't fail the test.
arr.author: Benjamin Franklin

arr.text: Defeat is not defeat unless you recognize it as such in your mind.
arr.author: Bruce Lee

arr.text: Failure is simply an opportunity to start again, but more wisely.
arr.author: Henry Ford

arr.text: I'm sure: You can't let the cheesy word 'you can't' stop you.
arr.author: Richard Branson

arr.text: Only he who never makes a mistake tries anything new.
arr.author: Albert Einstein

arr.text: You become what you believe in.
arr.author: Oprah Winfrey, TV host

arr.text: Happiness is not doing always what you want, but always wanting what you do.
arr.author: Leo Tolstoy

arr.text: I would rather die of passion than of boredom,
arr.author: Vincent van Gogh

arr.text: There are three times you learn fastest - before the age of 7, in training, and when life has backed you into a corner.
arr.author: Stephen Covey

arr.text: People will forget what you said, they will forget what you did, but they will never forget how you made them feel.
arr.author: Maya Angelou, writer and poet.

arr.text: Our consciousness is everything.
arr.author: Buddha

arr.text: If you want to build a ship, you don't have to convene people, plan, divide the work, get the tools.
arr.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

arr.text: Never assume that you already know everything.
arr.author: Ivan Pavlov, physiologist scientist

arr.text: It's not as important how slowly you walk as how long you walk without stopping.
arr.author: Confucius

arr.text: If you think about what you have in life, you can always have more.
arr.author: Oprah Winfrey

arr.text: Turn your large-scale thoughts into large-scale actions as quickly as possible.
arr.author: Donald Trump

arr.text: To lead people, go after them.
arr.author: Lao Tzu

arr.text: Remember that not achieving success is sometimes great luck, too.
arr.author: Dalai Lama

arr.text: Always choose the hardest path - you won't meet any competitors on it.
arr.author: Charles de Gaulle

arr.text: One completed productive task is worth fifty half-finished tasks.
arr.author: Malcolm Forbes

arr.text: Our lives begin to come to an end when we stop talking about the really important things.
arr.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

arr.text: Trouble doesn't come alone, but neither does good luck.
arr.author: Romain Rolland, writer

arr.text: Every thought is like a dough; if you crumple it well, you can make anything out of it
arr.author: Ivan Turgenev

arr.text: Do what you can where you are, using what you have.
arr.author: Theodore Roosevelt

arr.text: Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
arr.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

arr.text: The world is divided into two classes - some believe in the unbelievable, others do the impossible.
arr.author: Oscar Wilde

arr.text: The only happiness in life is the constant striving forward.
arr.author: Émile Zola

arr.text: It is not the strongest that survives, but the most receptive to change
arr.author: Charles Darwin

arr.text: You can say you have bad genetics, bad metabolism, or you can just get your ass up off the couch and start working on yourself, set a goal and believe in yourself.
arr.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

arr.text: Not falling down once is not the greatest merit in life.
arr.author: Nelson Mandela

arr.text: The question is not who will let me, but who can forbid me.
arr.author: Ayn Rand

arr.text: When it seems that the whole world is turned against you, remember that the plane does not take off in the wind, but against it.
arr.author: Henry Ford

arr.text: Life is not measured by how many years are in it, but by how much real life is in those years.
arr.author: Abraham Lincoln

arr.text: Doing good for the world is the only way to be happy.
arr.author: Hans Christian Andersen

arr.text: Either write something worthwhile or do something worth writing about.
arr.author: Benjamin Franklin

arr.text: The only way to do something very well is to love what you do.
arr.author: Steve Jobs

arr.text: A wise man demands everything of himself; a lowly man demands everything of others.
arr.author: Leo Tolstoy

arr.text: Great are those who see that thoughts rule the world.
arr.author: Ralph Emerson

arr.text: Before you climb the ladder of success, make sure it's leaned against the wall of the building you want.
arr.author: Stephen Covey

arr.text: At the root of every successful venture is a courageous decision once made.
arr.author: Peter Drucker, American economist
